chat.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to talk in a friendly informal way, especially about things that are not important
chat.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: John and I sat up until the early hours chatting.
Mary was there, chatting to her mother.
Susie chatted away about her social life.
chat.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to communicate with several people in a chat room on the Internet
chat.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0]: Chat is a reciprocal verb This type of verb is used when saying that two or more people or things do something that involves both or all of them
The boys were chatting with each other
He was chatting with the boys
chat.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: She was enjoying their friendly little chat.
She used to drop in for a chat quite often.
I’ve had a long chat with Vinnie.
